Conditions for the arrival of foreign nationals to Israel  Foreign nationals who will be arriving from orange or yellow destinations will be allowed to arrive in Israel and to stay in short isolation of 24 hours or until they test negative on the PCR test taken upon arrival in Israel (whichever is earlier), if they meet the conditions below.    Conditions for the arrival of foreign nationals to Israel  â¢	If you did not stay in any countries on the red list within 14 days before arrival in Israel.  â¢	If you've been vaccinated with a WHO (World Health Organization) approved vaccine in accordance with the required protocol in Israel, or if your recovery has been confirmed in accordance with the required protocol in Israel, and you have a digital certificate recognized by the Ministry of Health in Israel â see details below.  â¢	If there is no other hindrance for your arrival in Israel    Foreign nationals who will not meet these conditions will not be allowed to arrive in Israel, save for those who received a clearance for exceptional arrival from the Population and Immigration Authority.    Foreign nationals who are considered vaccinated  Foreign nationals vaccinated with the vaccines by Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca, Sinovac, Bharat Biotech, Sinopharm, Johnson and Johnson or Sputnik â in accordance with the required protocol in Israel:  â¢	Vaccinated with two vaccine doses (or a single dose in case of the Johnson and Johnson vaccine) and 14 days or more have passed since the date of the second dose on the day of arrival in Israel (and no more than 180 days on the day of leaving Israel). Not including the day of vaccination.  or:  â¢	They have been vaccinated with a booster dose and 14 days or more have passed since the date of the vaccination on the day of arrival in Israel. Not including the day of vaccination.    Foreign nationals vaccinated with the Sputnik vaccine:  Upon arrival in Israel, you are required to take a serologic test and to stay in isolation until you receive a positive result (in addition to the isolation of 24 hours or until you receive a negative result on the PCR test that you took at the airport in Israel.    Foreign nationals who are considered recovered  Foreign nationals who will present a certificate of recovery that can be digitally verified in the Ministry of Health's systems in Israel, based on a positive result on a PCR test (or a NAAT-based equivalent), provided:  â¢	On the day of entry to Israel, at least 8 days have passed since the date of the test (but no more than 190 days on the day of leaving Israel).  or:  â¢	They received at least one dose of the vaccines approved by the WHO (regardless of the sequence of events and the date of vaccination or recovery).    Source: https://archive.vn/rQ1g7 [Arrival of Foreign Nationals by Air Travel]
